item.title: Summerfall Studios announces roguelite deckbuilder Malys
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/summerfall-studios-announces-roguelite-deckbuilder-malys

Kickstarter campaign launching soon.

Stray Gods: The Roleplaying Musical developer Summerfall Studios has announced Malys, a roguelite deckbuilder currently in development. Platforms and a release date were not announced, but a Kickstarter campaign will launch soon with the goal of “[getting] a full 1.0 in your hands within the next six months of this campaign launching.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Summerfall Studios:

About

Exorcise the infernal and exact vengeance in this unholy roguelite deckbuilder from David Gaider and Summerfall Studios. Choose your path and strengthen your deck of arcane tricks. Expose, endure, and expel evil from the innocent possessed. Confront your past, forge precarious alliances, and uncover the truth.

As Noah, former priest turned exorcist and demon hunter, you ride the streets of this festering city in the dead of night. The city teems with demons, and among them lies your prey: Malys, a demon of extraordinary cunning and power. Use your deck to expose the rot within. Find unique combinations and strategies to withstand the horrors. Help the hopeless and free the possessed, or die in the attempt… over and over again.

Written by David Gaider (former BioWare lead writer on the Dragon Age series and creative director on Summerfall’s own Stray Gods: The Roleplaying Musical), Malys is a unique take on a familiar genre, pushing the boundaries of roguelite storytelling and delivering a satisfyingly moody experience.

Meet Noah

Noah, our protagonist for Malys, is a former priest turned tormented demon hunter.

item.title: SD Gundam G Generation ETERNAL launches April 16
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/sd-gundam-g-generation-eternal-launches-april-16

  • Smartphone

Free-to-play mobile strategy game dated.

Free-to-play strategy game SD Gundam G Generation ETERNAL will launch for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play on April 16, Bandai Namco announced. Pre-loading will begin on April 14.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

The latest title from the Gundam strategy game series G Generation is finally available on your smartphone!

Dive into the world of Gundam and enjoy the game’s unique system to upgrade, develop, and form squads with your favorite Mobile Suits and characters from your favorite series.

Enjoy the epic battles where characters and Mobile Suits from all the series clash together!

Key Features

  • The Most Mobile Suits and Characters Ever!
    • Play with over 500 Mobile Suits from 70 different Gundam titles! Choose your favorite characters and Mobile Suits, form the ultimate squad, and sortie into battle!
    • More titles and Mobile Suits will be added sequentially after the service launch.
  • Explore the Universe of Gundam!
    • In the Main Stage, you can immerse yourself in the stories from various Gundam titles. At launch, 10 Gundam titles’ scenarios will be playable, including the original “Mobile Suit Gundam”, “Mobile Suit Gundam W”, “Mobile Suit Gundam SEED”, “Mobile Suit Gundam 00”, “Mobile Suit Gundam IRON-BLOODED ORPHANS”, “Mobile Suit Gundam: The Witch from Mercury”, and more!
    • Whether you are familiar with the series or discovering them for the first time, enjoy iconic quotes and memorable scenes as you conquer each stage.
    • More scenarios will be added sequentially after the service launch.
  • In-Depth Strategy!
    • Place your units strategically and unleash their skills at the right time in this turn-based strategy game!
    • Discover the strengths and weaknesses of all units and use them to outsmart your enemies! Conquer missions with various objectives and challenges, and embark on a journey into the world of G Generation!
  • Upgrade, Develop, and Form Your Squad!
    • Over 300 Mobile Suits will be obtainable from Development at the service launch. Upgrade and develop your favorite Mobile Suits and characters, form a unique Squad, and lead it to victory! Get ready to dominate with your dream squad.
    • Are you ready to embark on more Gundam adventures?

item.title: The Ancient Magus’ Bride: Midsummer’s Mirage and the Journey of Dreams second trailer, first screenshots
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/the-ancient-magus-bride-midsummers-mirage-and-the-journey-of-dreams-second-trailer-first-screenshots

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch

Visual novel due out on October 2.

Publisher Bushiroad Games and developer Mebius have released the second official trailer and first screenshots for visual novel The Ancient Magus’ Bride: Midsummer’s Mirage and the Journey of Dreams.

Here is the story synopsis:

A non-human, living alone in the night of London.

One evening, he meets a girl seeking help in the fog.

She has lost her memories and knows not why she is there.

In saving her from the darkness, the two become fast friends.

The non-human, wishing to help his very first friend recover her memories, makes for two beings he has heard about by way of rumors among the fae: the Thorn Mage Elias, and Chise.

The Ancient Magus’ Bride: Midsummer’s Mirage and the Journey of Dreams is due out for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam on October 2 with English and Japanese language support. In Japan, a physical edition will also be available for Switch.

item.title: Star Wars Outlaws coming to Switch 2 in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/star-wars-outlaws-coming-to-switch-2-in-2025

  • Switch 2

Open-world action adventure game comes to the Nintendo platform.

Publisher Ubisoft and developer Massive Entertainment will release a Switch 2 version of open-world action adventure game Star Wars Outlaws in 2025, the companies announced.

Star Wars Outlaws first launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Ubisoft Store on August 30, 2024, followed by PC via Steam on November 21.

Here is an overview of the game, via Ubisoft:

In Star Wars Outlaws, fans play as cunning scoundrel, Kay Vess (Humberly Gonzalez), and her loyal companion Nix (Dee Bradley Baker, Star Wars: The Bad Batch), as they attempt one of the greatest heists the Outer Rim has ever seen. Seeking the means to start a new life, players will join Kay and Nix as they fight, steal, and outwit their way through the galaxy’s crime syndicates and join the most wanted.
